title: Rumble has a 76% Pick/ban rate and a 71% win rate in LCS

replies.body: I started on Viktor's Laser as a quick-cast, so it doesn't phase me. Maybe try that? After all, a similar ability with a faster CD is better for practice.
Ever thought about turning quick cast off? He's much easier to play then.
You can put the specific ability off quick cast, and the rest on.

If you train yourself without quick cast you can pull off combos just as fast. Some champs need quick cast, that's why their default abilities don't come with range indicators. But Others have skill shots that are so punishing to miss (like a rumble ult) that you really should have some foresight to aim before you spam R
Stupid thing for a daily reminder. Those statistics will have changed by the end of the week.

Rumble is insanely OP actually.

Manaless, AP, autoattack steroid, massive AOE, massive base damage with 0 items, teamwiping damage with items, can 1v2 or lane bully 1v1.

Because the pick/ban/win rates at the competitive level actually mean something outside of the competitive level, and everyone is able to mimic the same level of play as the pros to achieve those numbers.

Kappa

but rumble was always a thing.
about time he started seeing more light.

remember when renekton was the go to top laner?
then shyv?

yeah. rumble was still a beast.
Lol you can't find a champ to cry about in solo queue so now you start bitching about rumble in lcs xD
So? Champion strong in competitive is strong in competitive, it's not a news story.
But nah man gotta nerf Zed
hes just good right now against popular top lane champions.
